comments.author: Trevor Higgins
comments.comment: Should this not be "Short notice deployment" to follow the "Military Exigency Family" style of first letter in capitals? If this is due to the value in the application, you should question that from the developer/PO.

comments.author: Deirdre McCaffrey
comments.comment: In the context of Military Exigency Family, "Short notice deployment" is quite a healthy specimen as all qualifiers for this absence reason, bar one, are in sentence case. However, the majority of ALL absence reasons and qualifiers are indeed camel case, so Ive raised http://jira/browse/FAB-6365 to clarify and deal separately with this variance.

comments.comment:
Still no class level javadoc, describe the purpose of this test class. Each test javadoc then describes the actual test. For example, class level should be
This class holds all tests related to end-to-end tests for New York Plans. These plans are the most broad plans that we have and are a good basis for hitting a happy path of tests - hence why New York plan was chosen. etc.

comments.author: Trevor Higgins
comments.comment: Javadoc is impossible to read if you hover over the method name, please use <br/> tag to force new line. Javadoc is built and delivered to customers so it should be readable.

comments.author: Trevor Higgins
comments.comment:
Not really clear on what this is testing. Is the test to copy the plan, or to do and E2E of intake, or both?.
If we are changing the details of the New York plan, and those details are relevant to the test result, we need to call that out.

comments.author: Aisling Clinch
comments.comment: I;ve just added this as a descriptuion _Copy Full Time New York Leave Plan & create an Absence Case for this plan._ will need to be revisited when this test is fleshed out!

comments.author: Trevor Higgins
comments.comment: No javadoc of the paramters - what are they for, are both of these mandatory etc.

comments.author: Trevor Higgins
comments.comment:
Why are we passing the LeavePlanCopyPage_General parameter? The method exists on the LeavePlanCopyPage_General class, there is no need to pass it in again. Instead, you use the "this" reference, which implicitly points at the instance of the current class, in this case the instance of LeavePlanCopyPage_General.
Please read up on https://stackoverflow.com/questions/8708216/use-of-this-keyword-in-java
Please remove @param as well

comments.author: Trevor Higgins
comments.comment:
The JIRA is marked as "Under Review" implying no more code is giong to change, so not clear on when this TODO will be implemented...
Leaving this volumne of TODO with commented out code is not good. Can we not remove it, since its in SVN history anyway, or else point towards a JIRA where it will be implemented.
